description: Complete PostgreSQL database schema with tables for users, workers, businesses, jobs, bookings, wallets, transactions, reviews, and compliance records. Includes Row Level Security policies to ensure data isolation and proper access control.
workflow_rationale: Database schema setup follows a migration pattern: (1) Prepare migration files and directory structure, (2) Execute schema creation with tables, RLS policies, and indexes, (3) Cleanup with verification and seed data.

phases.name: Prepare Migration Structure
phases.description: Create Supabase migration directory structure and prepare for schema creation

subtasks.description: Create Supabase migration directory structure
Create initial schema migration file with core tables

phases.name: Create Database Schema
phases.description: Create all tables, enums, and relationships in the database

subtasks.description: Create enum types for job_status and booking_status

verification.instructions: Verify enums are created: job_status (open, in_progress, completed, cancelled), booking_status (pending, accepted, rejected, in_progress, completed, cancelled)

subtasks.description: Create users table with auth integration

verification.command: grep -q 'CREATE TABLE users' supabase/migrations/20250222000001_initial_schema.sql && echo 'Users table defined'

subtasks.notes: Added foreign key reference to auth.users(id), handle_new_user() function with trigger for auto-sync on signup, and CASCADE delete

subtasks.description: Create workers and businesses tables with user relationships

verification.command: grep -q 'CREATE TABLE workers\|CREATE TABLE businesses' supabase/migrations/20250222000001_initial_schema.sql && echo 'Profile tables defined'

subtasks.notes: Workers and businesses tables already properly defined with user_id foreign key references, CASCADE delete, UNIQUE constraint for one-to-one relationship, location indexes, and updated_at triggers

subtasks.description: Create skills and categories tables

verification.command: grep -q 'CREATE TABLE skills\|CREATE TABLE categories' supabase/migrations/20250222000001_initial_schema.sql && echo 'Lookup tables defined'

subtasks.description: Create jobs and jobs_skills junction table

verification.command: grep -q 'CREATE TABLE jobs\|CREATE TABLE jobs_skills' supabase/migrations/20250222000001_initial_schema.sql && echo 'Jobs tables defined'

subtasks.description: Create bookings table with business/worker/job relationships

verification.command: grep -q 'CREATE TABLE bookings' supabase/migrations/20250222000001_initial_schema.sql && echo 'Bookings table defined'

subtasks.description: Create transactions table for payments

verification.command: grep -q 'CREATE TABLE transactions' supabase/migrations/20250222000001_initial_schema.sql && echo 'Transactions table defined'

subtasks.description: Create messages, reviews, and notifications tables

verification.command: grep -q 'CREATE TABLE messages\|CREATE TABLE reviews\|CREATE TABLE notifications' supabase/migrations/20250222000001_initial_schema.sql && echo 'Communication tables defined'

subtasks.description: Create reports and webhooks tables

verification.command: grep -q 'CREATE TABLE reports\|CREATE TABLE webhooks' supabase/migrations/20250222000001_initial_schema.sql && echo 'Admin tables defined'

phases.name: Implement RLS Policies
phases.description: Create Row Level Security policies for all tables to ensure data isolation

subtasks.description: Enable RLS and create policies for users table

verification.instructions: Verify users table has RLS enabled with policies: users can read/update their own data, admins can read all

subtasks.description: Create RLS policies for workers table

verification.instructions: Verify workers table has RLS policies: workers can read own profile, public can read verified workers, admins full access

subtasks.description: Create RLS policies for businesses table

verification.instructions: Verify businesses table has RLS policies: businesses can read own data, public can read verified businesses, admins full access

subtasks.description: Create RLS policies for jobs table

verification.instructions: Verify jobs table has RLS policies: businesses can read own jobs, workers can read open jobs, admins full access

subtasks.description: Create RLS policies for bookings table

verification.instructions: Verify bookings table has RLS policies: users can see own bookings, businesses see own business bookings, admins full access

subtasks.description: Create RLS policies for transactions table

verification.instructions: Verify transactions table has RLS policies: users can read own transactions, admins full access

subtasks.description: Create RLS policies for reviews, messages, notifications tables

verification.instructions: Verify communication tables have RLS policies: users read own data, admins full access

phases.name: Create Indexes
phases.description: Create indexes for performance optimization on foreign keys and commonly queried columns

subtasks.description: Create indexes for foreign key columns
Create indexes for status and timestamp columns

phases.name: Create Seed Data and Verify
phases.description: Create seed data for development testing and verify the complete schema

subtasks.description: Create seed data file with test data
Create Supabase config file if needed
Verify schema matches TypeScript types

verification.instructions: Compare all tables in SQL schema with TypeScript types to ensure 1:1 match

subtasks.description: Test migration with Supabase CLI

parallelism.speedup_estimate: Sequential execution - each phase depends on previous

acceptance_criteria: All required tables are created with proper relationships
RLS policies prevent cross-user data access
Indexes are created for performance optimization
Enums are defined for job_status and booking_status
Foreign key constraints maintain data integrity
Test data can be seeded for development

verification_steps.name: Schema Validation
verification_steps.expected_outcome: All migrations apply successfully without errors

verification_steps.name: RLS Policy Verification
verification_steps.command: psql $DATABASE_URL -c "SELECT schemaname, tablename, policyname FROM pg_policies WHERE schemaname = 'public';"
verification_steps.expected_outcome: All tables have RLS policies defined

verification_steps.name: Index Verification
verification_steps.command: psql $DATABASE_URL -c "SELECT indexname, tablename FROM pg_indexes WHERE schemaname = 'public' ORDER BY tablename;"

verification_steps.name: TypeScript Type Alignment
verification_steps.expected_outcome: All tables in SQL match TypeScript types

verification_strategy.reasoning: High risk because this is foundational database schema. Any issues here will affect all features built on top. RLS policies are security-critical and must be thoroughly verified.
